parameters.content:
## Template overview

This workflow emails new leads, notifies your team, and updates your sheet.
Any form works as long as it writes a row into Google Sheets.
Flow: Sheets Trigger → (short Wait) → AI creates Subject/Body/Tag → Gmail sends → Slack notifies → Sheet logs status and lead type.
Connect your own Google Sheets, Gmail/SMTP, Slack, and OpenAI keys before running.

## Google Sheets Trigger
Fires when a new row is added to your form responses tab.
Pick the correct spreadsheet and tab name.
Expected headers: Timestamp, Name, Email Address, Phone Number, Services Interested In, Budget Range, Preferred Contact Time, Project Timeline, Additional Comments.
Tip: submit a real form entry to test (do not paste rows).

## Wait (buffer)
A 1–2 second pause so Google finishes writing the row before we read it.
You can shorten or remove this once writes are stable.

## Create Email & Tag (AI)
Feeds the row into OpenAI to produce three JSON fields: Subject, Body, Tag.
Tag = High / Medium / Low using simple budget/services/timeline rules in the prompt.
If it errors, check your OpenAI key, model name, and that the prompt asks for JSON only.

## Send Email
Sends the model's Subject and Body to the lead's Email Address.
Use Gmail or SMTP with your own mailbox.
Test with your email first to confirm formatting and deliverability.

## Update Status
Writes Status and Tag back to the same sheet so you can track outcomes.
Currently matches by Name. If you have duplicates, switch to Timestamp or a unique ID.

## Notify Team (Slack)
Posts a short alert with the lead's name, services, budget, and a link to the sheet row.
Set the Slack channel you want and connect your Slack credential.
